result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua E. Wakefield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
22CM454 Dismissed and read in. 
Four days sentence credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide a DNA sample. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua E. Wakefield

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Time to Pay Summary mailed to defendant

10:03 AM cases 22CF228, 22CM454 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua E. Wakefield in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joshua E. Wakefield. Court and Attorney Rivard have a colloquy regarding entering a not guilty plea if there is an agreement. Attorney Rivard would like to enter a plea. 
 In 22CF228: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Attorney Rivard makes a correction to the Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form. 
In 22CF228: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Sex Offender- Fail/Update Information (Repeater). 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and withholds sentencing. Defendant is placed on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Comply with the Sex Offender Registry. Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges. 
Anything else is dismissed and read in. Defendant has 4 days sentence credit if revoked for Probation.

10:00 AM cases 22CF228, 22CM454 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua E. Wakefield in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joshua E. Wakefield. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Cases are referred to Branch 3 for ARGN.

Conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
covers 22CF228 and 22CM454

11:33 AM cases 22CF228 and 22CM454 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua E. Wakefield appeared by video with Attorney Sonia Anderson. 
Warrants have been executed/are quashed. Defendant advised of charges and waives further reading of the complaint. Time limits for the preliminary hearing are waived. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/22/22 at 2:45 PM. Return to court 7/11/22 at 9:30  AM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
(Covers 22CF228, 22CM454)
